info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 6:18PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON... SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...CENTRAL BEAVER...SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER... NORTHWESTERN ALLEGHENY AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 618 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near East Liverpool, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Moon Township, Franklin Park, East Liverpool, Aliquippa, Monaca, Wellsville, Robinson Township, Economy, and Bellevue. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 27 and 33. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 67 and 80. Parkway North between mile markers 8 and 13. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 35 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
